alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Bayfield; Burnett; Douglas; Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Heat Advisory issued September 02 at 3:21PM CDT until September 03 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7 PM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heat index values up to 105 expected. * WHERE...In Minnesota, South Cass, Crow Wing, South Aitkin, Carlton and South St. Louis and Pine Counties. In Wisconsin, Douglas, Bayfield, Ashland, Burnett, Washburn and Sawyer Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Fond du Lac Band, the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation, the Bad River Reservation, the St. Croix Band in Burnett County, the Red Cliff Band and the Mille Lacs Band, East Lake, Lena Lake and, Hinckley areas. * WHEN...From noon to 7 PM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Near record breaking high temperatures are expected in the heat advisory area with temperatures in the mid to upper 90s with heat indices of near 100 to 105.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Ashland; Bayfield; Burnett; Douglas; Sawyer; Washburn
